    Avoiding Data Project Failures

    1 minute read

    On this page

    • Why Should I Further Read This?
      • Short Term
        • Transparency
        • Reproducibility
      • Long Term

    Data Analytics is more than ‘Analytics’. Regardless of the size of your analysis or project implementation, future proofing said items with either documentation, tests, or transparency ensures both short term and long term success for your team and organization.

    That being said, I discuss some borrowed Project Management skillsets that’s helped me become sucessful with short & long term impact. This can be seen in the following:

    • Short Term
      • Transparency
      • Reproducibility
    • Long Term
      • Documentation
      • Requirements Gathering
        • Business Requirement Documents
        • Project Requirement Documents

    Why Should I Further Read This?

    • I was a contributor to a high impact project under Agile Methodology
    • I helped and assisted with migrations and reporting at a agile paced team in a top 5 Tech Company
    • I currently contribute best, or at least better, practices in my team with eclectic project management skill-sets I learned from the preceding mentions

    Short Term

    Transparency

    Scenario:

    My business analyst provides a report on Company X’s user engagement, per request. However, I notice the y-axis on my visualization is blank. Moreover, why is there a trough, dropping, in March 2020?

    What happened?

    As an analyst, we provided a report from a requested user as some point of time $t$. However, what happens if we do not consider the following:

    • Virality
      • How frequent will this report be shared?
    • Lifespan
      • Will this report be resurfaced? If so, when? * Will this report be shared again business analyst provided the report, but now you Time and time again

        Reproducibility

    Long Term

    about something that’s been on my mind the past year. And with recently working with particular Analytics Engineering best practices, it further ins
